title: Classification Matrix MicroSim
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Interactive 2x2 classification matrix for learning prioritization and decision-making frameworks
description: An interactive p5.js MicroSim where learners drag and drop items to classify them using a 2x2 matrix with Complexity (High/Low) on the vertical axis and Impact (High/Low) on the horizontal axis. Quadrants are labeled Quick Wins, Strategic Projects, Fill-ins, and Time Sinks. Features draggable items, per-quadrant item counts, and a reset button.
source: Original creation for automating instructional design textbook
relation: Part of the Automating Instructional Design intelligent textbook
coverage: Educational technology, instructional design, decision-making frameworks
audience: Instructional designers, educators, project managers, students
technicalRequirements: Modern web browser with JavaScript enabled
learningObjectives: Understand the key concepts of classification matrix
Explore classification matrix through interactive visualization
Apply knowledge of classification matrix to solve problems
Test understanding of classification matrix through interactive exercises
